definition: fart/flatulence/nonsense/(usu. in the negative) what/(not) a damn thing
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to fart/to break wind/to talk nonsense/Utter rubbish!
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
lit. bum beetle/sb who tags along/shadow/sycophant
to wipe one’s ass/(fig.) (coll.) to clean up sb else's mess
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
incoherent (writing or speech)/nonsensical/a load of crap

sentences.chinese: 他說，“我沒做飯，我剛放了個屁。”

sentences.english: I just told him to pretend like I'd done a really bad fart.
sentences.chinese: 我就告訴他假裝我剛放了一個很醜的屁。

sentences.english: The right person is still gonna think the sun shines out of your ass.
sentences.chinese: 總之對路的人會覺得你放的屁都是香的。

sentences.english: Shier on the back, you say nothing of it personally, you will when I put a bunch of fart.
sentences.chinese: 上回的事兒，你甭往心裏去，你就當我放了一串屁。

sentences.english: Where both parties find eath other'gas just the cutest thing in the world.
sentences.chinese: 這是雙方都覺得對方的屁是世界上最可愛的東西。

sentences.english: Even the Americans release A Pi where they are in the incense.
sentences.chinese: 就連美國人放的一個屁在他們那裏都是香的。

sentences.english: In fact while I've been in here I must have farted at least 20 times.
sentences.chinese: 事實上從我坐在這裏到現在已經至少放了20個屁了。

sentences.english: There was once a ghost, one day he put a fart and then died.
sentences.chinese: 從前有一個鬼，一天他放了一個屁然後就死了。

sentences.english: I was startled so bad that I jumped, yelped, and a high-pitched fart snuck out.
sentences.chinese: 我嚇得跳了起來，大叫了一聲，並放了一個很響的屁。

sentences.english: Even the sound of a fart will shake the floor of the third floor.
sentences.chinese: 放個屁聲音大點兒三樓的樓板都震顫。

sentences.english: Farts burn with a blue or yellow flame.
sentences.chinese: 屁燃燒時會產生藍或黃色的火焰。

sentences.english: Im so hungry I am farting fresh air.
sentences.chinese: 我餓，放的屁都是新鮮空氣。

sentences.english: Why do we like the smell of our own farts?
sentences.chinese: 我們爲啥喜歡自己的屁？

sentences.english: A blue flame is indicative of the presence of methane in the flatus.
sentences.chinese: 藍色火苗意味着屁裏含有甲烷。

sentences.english: The National Weather Agency assigns names to her farts .
sentences.chinese: 你媽媽胖到連國家氣象局都要替她的屁命名。

sentences.english: If she accidentally passes gas, burps, etc.
sentences.chinese: 如果她不小心放了屁或打飽嗝等等。

definition: to fart/to break wind/to talk nonsense/Utter rubbish!
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
father/daddy/"I, your father" (in anger, or out of contempt)/I (used arrogantly or jocularly)
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
